cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 355 miles SSW of New Orleans, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north today, then accelerating north-northeast across the southeastern U.S. and emerging off the Mid-Atlantic coast Thursday evening, passing just south of New York before racing into the Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana near Morgan City/Port Fourchon

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch west of Morgan City to Intracoastal City, Louisiana
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Morgan City LA to MS/AL border (incl. Lake Pontchartrain & metro New Orleans); Tropical Storm Warning MS/AL border to Walton/Bay County Line FL; Storm Surge Warning Mouth of Atchafalaya River LA to Navarre FL (incl. Lake Borgne, Pontchartrain, Pensacola Bay, Mobile Bay)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast (LA, MS, AL, FL Panhandle) today, then inland Southeast, Appalachians and Mid-Atlantic coast (NC–NJ) Thursday
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are possible (peak 24% chance) with gusts 40–50 mph late Thursday afternoon through late Thursday night.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the New York–New Jersey harbor given the fast-moving track and offshore passage.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with isolated higher amounts up to 6 inches could fall Thursday–Thursday night, producing urban and small-stream flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor coastal flooding at times of high tide, dangerous surf and rip currents, brief disruption to harbor pilotage and container operations.
